solution.p: The numerator of the fraction is 016, or 16. The last digit, 6, is in the thousandths place, so the denominator of the fraction is 1000. Thus, 0.016=\dfrac{16}{1000}. We can reduce this fraction by dividing top and bottom by 8: ~ \dfrac{16}{1000} = \dfrac{\cancel{8} \cdot 2}{\cancel{8} \cdot 125} = \dfrac{2}{125}
Using a calculator, divide 5 by 11: 5~\boxed{\div}~1 = 0.45454545 ... This is a nonterminating decimal, which we indicate by a repeater bar: \dfrac{5}{11}= 0.45454545 ... = 0.\overline{45}

statement.p: Solve ~0.6x^4 = 578. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: First, we isolate the power. \begin{aligned}[t] 0.6x^4 \amp = 578 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 0.6.}}\\ x^4 \amp = 963.\overline{3} \end{aligned} We raise both sides to the reciprocal of the power. \begin{aligned}[t] (x^4)^{1/4} \amp = (963.\overline{3})^{1/4} \amp\amp \blert{\text{By the third law of exponents,}~ (x^4)^{1/4}=x.}\\ x \amp = 5.57 \end{aligned} To evaluate (963.\overline{3})^{1/4}, enter ~~\text{ANS}~\boxed{\wedge{}}~.25

First, we isolate the power. \begin{aligned}[t] x^{2/3}-4 \amp = 60 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Add 4 to both sides.}}\\ x^{2/3} \amp = 64 \end{aligned} We raise both sides to the reciprocal of the power. \begin{aligned}[t] (x^{2/3})^{3/2} \amp = 64^{3/2} \amp\amp \blert{64^{3/2}=(64^{1/2})^3=8^3}\\ x \amp = 512 \end{aligned} Or we can evaluate ~64^{3/2}~ by entering ~~64~\boxed{\wedge{}}~1.5

statement.p: Solve ~18x^{0.24} = 6.5. Round your answer to thousandths.

solution.p: First, we isolate the power. \begin{aligned}[t] 18x^{0.24} \amp = 6.5 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 18.}}\\ x^{0.24} \amp = 0.36\overline{1} \end{aligned}
